results.title: The Secret world of Odilon Redon
results.creator_credit: Rodney Wilson, Kevala Films and Stephen Cross
results.brief_description: Odilon Redon was a major figure in the French Symbolist movement. He dedicated his art to “bringing to life improbable beings”, searching for them in the world of dreams. The film shows many of his early charcoal drawings and lithographs and ends with his pastels and oils and the frescoes of “Night” and “Day” at the Abbay de Fontfroide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rodney Wilson, Kevala Films and Stephen Cross

results.title: The Secret way
results.brief_description: Uses animated puppets to tell the story of a mischievous small boy who sets traps for birds, gets lost in the forest, is rescued by a crow, and learns to give sympathy and care to his non-human neighbours on the farm.

results.title: The Secret sharer
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Larry Yust and Joseph Conrad
results.brief_description: A screen adaptation of a Joseph Conrad short story. This film concerns a young, inexperienced sea captain’s encounter with a fugitive from naval justice. Follows the captain endangering his ship through helping the fugitive, and shows how he regains control.

results.title: The Secret policeman's other ball
results.creator_credit: Amnesty International, Martin Lewis, Peter Walker and Julien Temple
results.brief_description: Featuring some of Britain’s most loved and highly respected entertainers of comedy and rock music, this filmed live performance at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, London is an absolute ball - witty, outrageous, political, funny, but most of all, entertaining. It combines the winning elements of comedy sketches including some memorable Monty Python skits, stand-up comedy, and music performances by such stars as Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Tim Brooke-Taylor, Graham Chapman, Alexei Sayle, Bob Geldof, Jeff Beck, Eric Clapton, Donovan, Sting, Phil Collins and even Australia’s own inimitable Barry Humphries. Also features a special guest appearance by Michael Palin. Presented by Amnesty International with all royalties from the video going to Amnesty International. Stage show directed by Ronald Eyre.

results.title: The Secret of the Murray
results.creator_credit: Richard Walker and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers [Bill Peach]”.
Dramatised documentary written and presented by Bill Peach recounting the exploration of New South Wale’s river system. In 1828, Charles Sturt, a young English army captain lacking formal qualifications or practical bushman skill, was chosen to explore Australia’s western rivers. Hamilton Hume was appointed second in charge of the expedition and provided the guidance and support that enabled Sturt to unlock the secrets of Australia’s rivers and explode the myth that Australia was a giant basin with its waters draining into an inland sea. His greatest feat was charting the course of the Murray River to the sea. Sturt was an ambitious man who never achieved the high rank that he desired. In an act of ambitious flattery he named the Murray river after the Secretary for the Colonies rather than recognise the discovery made by Hume and Hovell.

His greatest feat was charting the course of the Murray River to the sea. Sturt was an ambitious man who never achieved the high rank that he desired. In an act of ambitious flattery he named the Murray river after the Secretary for the Colonies rather than recognise the discovery made by Hume and Hovell.

results.title: The Secret of Roan Inish
results.creator_credit: Peter Newman Productions, Sarah Green, Maggie Renzi and John Sayles
results.brief_description: The Coneelly family, now living on the isolated west coast of Ireland, has been displaced from Roan Inish, the small, mysterious island which they shared with herds of seals. Fiona is sent to live there with her grandparents and becomes determined to penetrate the secrets of her family’s mysterious past and the legends they all embrace. Cast includes Mick Lally, Eileen Colgan, John Lynch and Jeni Courtney.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh 2: Timmy to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Paul Sabella, Jonathan Dern and Dick Sebast
results.brief_description: Jonathan Brisby, the bravest of all rats died in saving his fellow creatures from the evil clutches of NIMH. Once escaped, the rats made a home for themselves in Thorn Valley. It was predicted that one day the forces of NIMH would rise again and the son of Jonathan Brisby would save them; the destiny of rats lies with Timmy Brisby. Feeling the pressure to be the hero his father was, Timmy begins his journey with Jeremy the crow where he is placed under the tutelage of Mr Ages and fellow elders who equip him with the tools to face his destiny. A female rat called Jenny makes it to the village and implores them to return to NIMH with her and save the rats from the evil Doctor Valentine. The council decides against helping her however, and when Timmy discovers elder brother Martin is a prisoner at NIMH, he and Jenny decide to save the rats themselves. Made for television 16 years after the original and features musical numbers. Features the voices of Dom DeLuise, Eric Idle, Ralph Macchio, William H. Macy and Hynden Walch. Narrated by Peter MacNicoll.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Aurora, Don Bluth and Gary Goldman
results.brief_description: The story of timid Mrs Brisby, a widowed field mouse who must summon the courage to defy man, beast and nature against the imminent destruction of her home before Farmer Fitzgibbon’s spring plowing. With the help of love-sick Jeremy the crow and the mysterious rats of NIMH (super intelligent creatures residing in the farmer’s rosebush), she finds the strength to overcome the obstacles that threaten her family. Based on the story by Robert C. O’Brien.

results.title: The Secret of muscles
results.creator_credit: Hungarofilm, Budapest Filmstudio and Dezso Varasdy
results.brief_description: Muscles are the only organisms in man capable of doing mechanical work. Masses of tiny fibres comprise the muscle tissue. Diagrams illustrate how the fibres fit together and how the processes of stretching and contracting result in movement. Ballet and gymnastics demonstrate how muscles can be used.

results.title: The Secret love of Sandra Blain
results.creator_credit: Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors and Jim Tartan
results.brief_description: The step by step progression into alcoholism of a wife and mother is shown as Sandra Blain deceives her friends, family, physician and herself. The film focuses attention on the facilities and treatments available for the successful treatment and recovery of victims of the disease of alcoholism.
